title: error[E0117] provides misleading explanation.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: [rust playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&code=impl%20Drop%20for%20u32%7B%7D%0A%0Afn%20main()%7B%0A%20%20%20%20println!(%22Hey!%22)%0A%7D)
(This is straight-up copypasted from the error docs for E0117)

```rust
impl Drop for u32{}

fn main(){
    println!("Hey!")
}
```

The current output is, amongst other things:

```
error[E0117]: only traits defined in the current crate can be implemented for arbitrary types
 --> src/main.rs:1:1
  |
1 | impl Drop for u32{}
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^---
  | |             |
  | |             `u32` is not defined in the current crate
  | impl doesn't use only types from inside the current crate
  |
  = note: define and implement a trait or new type instead
```

The sentence "impl doesn't use only types from inside the current crate" isn't clear to me.
I'm not completely sure on how to change it, maybe you could repeat the error description.

My rationale is that in this case, given the arbitrary type, the presence or absence of it in the crate isn't relevant, since you can't redefine u32.
In my opinion the message should instead be focused on the location of the trait.
